intro: Arabis stricta, commonly known as narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbage and mustard. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. The plant is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in mountainous areas.
